### PR summary [9d06f09332](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15646/commits/9d06f093326d6817f4b07ceb0fc7742f204411bd)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.PresentedGroup | 752 | 623 | -129 (-17.15%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.DoubleCoset | 747 | 620 | -127 (-17.00%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.CharZero.Quotient | 751 | 629 | -122 (-16.25%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.Colimits | 849 | 727 | -122 (-14.37%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Pointwise.Stabilizer | 756 | 648 | -108 (-14.29%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.EpiMono | 862 | 740 | -122 (-14.15%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.ModEq | 754 | 674 | -80 (-10.61%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupAction.Quotient | 760 | 683 | -77 (-10.13%) |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.Basic | 757 | 681 | -76 (-10.04%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Divisible | 752 | 684 | -68 (-9.04%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Coxeter.Basic | 871 | 825 | -46 (-5.28%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Group.Basic | 910 | 878 | -32 (-3.52%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Ring.Basic | 924 | 893 | -31 (-3.35%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.InfiniteSum.Group | 927 | 923 | -4 (-0.43%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Finiteness | 752 | 750 | -2 (-0.27%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Index | 776 | 774 | -2 (-0.26%) |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Quotient | 798 | 796 | -2 (-0.25%) |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Alternating.DomCoprod | 882 | 880 | -2 (-0.23%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.InfiniteSum.Nonarchimedean | 1015 | 1013 | -2 (-0.20%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.Abelianization | 763 | 762 | -1 (-0.13%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.OrderOfElement | 783 | 782 | -1 (-0.13%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 334 files with changed transitive imports: this is too many to display!

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

> lgtm, though I'd prefer you keep the import statements sorted

I think this is a problem with `shake`, actually. When splitting, I try to leave imports "as is" (i.e. I replace the split file with the "last" of its split children), and then just let `shake` deal with minimising imports.

My preference is not to add the busy work for humans to resort imports, and either automate resorting imports periodically, or change `shake`.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by tb65536.

Yes. 

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10427390191/job/28882000011)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10427390191/job/28882000378)
lgtm, though I'd prefer you keep the import statements sorted
lgtm, though I'd prefer you keep the import statements sorted
Can you please put those at the top?

We're actually already split in Mathlib as to whether these go at the top or bottom. I'm unsure myself which is better. At the top means they are closer to the import statements, at the bottom they are less clutter in the way of a normal reader who just wants to start reading declarations.

Looking for consensus at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/345428-mathlib-reviewers/topic/.60assert_not_exists.60.20at.20top.20or.20bottom.20of.20file.3F/near/459960523. I'll mark these as resolved in the meantime and we can cleanup later as required.
Ditto
Ditto

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: avoid importing `Cardinal` in basic group theory
